Precautionary Statement Codes

P261, P264, P264+P265, P270, P271, P280, P301+P317, P302+P352, P304+P340, P305+P351+P338, P317, P319, P321, P330, P332+P317, P337+P317, P362+P364, P403+P233, P405, and P501

(The corresponding statement to each P-code can be found at the GHS Classification page.)

ECHA C&L Notifications Summary

Aggregated GHS information provided per 63 reports by companies from 9 notifications to the ECHA C&L Inventory. Each notification may be associated with multiple companies.

Information may vary between notifications depending on impurities, additives, and other factors. The percentage value in parenthesis indicates the notified classification ratio from companies that provide hazard codes. Only hazard codes with percentage values above 10% are shown. For more detailed information, please visit ECHA C&L website.

                    This excerpt provides detailed information on the GHS hazard classification, specifically highlighting respiratory irritation (H335) with a prevalence of 14.3%, along with associated precautionary statement codes used for safety labeling. It also summarizes the ECHA C&L notifications, indicating the aggregated hazard data from multiple company reports, emphasizing the variability and classification ratios. This section contextualizes the chemical's hazard profile and regulatory safety information within the full PubChem datasheet.
